tags: i know il like way behind but like
(oh god and i haven't seen the first campaign at all)
that one is going to take a while
summary: Episode 12
body:
Episode 12

Ok so I need to rant about critical role somewhere but OMG, episode 12 of the second campaign though! BEST EPISODE SO FAR FOR ME. Everything was fine then the hospital thing happened (which was hilarious ahzbxbxbbdd) and then all the breaking and entering stuff THE CARPET and then WHEN EVERYTHING STARTS HITTING THE FAN plus that CLIFFHANGER. It was perfect and I cant wait to get more into this series!!!

summary: I don’t know why, but I just adore watching Fjord teleport and bampf all over the place. Every time he casts Thunderstep, or...
body: I don’t know why, but I just adore watching Fjord teleport and bampf all over the place. Every time he casts Thunderstep, or Misty Step, or Blink, and especially now that he uses Relentless Hex to teleport…..oh man. Fljeeing Fjord is the best Fjord y’all

tags: this poor roc is gonna be like the hapless bandits from the beginning of the campaign
summary: dragonfairies replied to your post:  My friend has only seen about half the first...I thought the Rok from c1 was near Oman? And...
body:
dragonfairies replied to your post:

My friend has only seen about half the first…

I thought the Rok from c1 was near Oman? And then they asked it to move because it was eating livestock? Vasselheim was too far north for natural farming. I could be wrong.

Yes, the roc was harrying farmers outside of Emon, and Vox Machina (eventually) persuaded her gnome friend to relocate her to the wilderness around Vasselheim where she could hunt the wildlife there and would be safe from monster hunters because of the influence of the Slayers’ Take. We just got turned around in thinking that Vasselheim was in Wildemount, which it’s not. Still a beautiful mental image, though. :D

reblog.comment:
dragonfairies replied to your post:

My friend has only seen about half the first…

I thought the Rok from c1 was near Oman? And then they asked it to move because it was eating livestock? Vasselheim was too far north for natural farming. I could be wrong.

Yes, the roc was harrying farmers outside of Emon, and Vox Machina (eventually) persuaded her gnome friend to relocate her to the wilderness around Vasselheim where she could hunt the wildlife there and would be safe from monster hunters because of the influence of the Slayers’ Take. We just got turned around in thinking that Vasselheim was in Wildemount, which it’s not. Still a beautiful mental image, though. :D

trail.content_raw:
dragonfairies replied to your post:

My friend has only seen about half the first…

I thought the Rok from c1 was near Oman? And then they asked it to move because it was eating livestock? Vasselheim was too far north for natural farming. I could be wrong.

Yes, the roc was harrying farmers outside of Emon, and Vox Machina (eventually) persuaded her gnome friend to relocate her to the wilderness around Vasselheim where she could hunt the wildlife there and would be safe from monster hunters because of the influence of the Slayers’ Take. We just got turned around in thinking that Vasselheim was in Wildemount, which it’s not. Still a beautiful mental image, though. :D
trail.content:
dragonfairies replied to your post:

My friend has only seen about half the first…

I thought the Rok from c1 was near Oman? And then they asked it to move because it was eating livestock? Vasselheim was too far north for natural farming. I could be wrong.

Yes, the roc was harrying farmers outside of Emon, and Vox Machina (eventually) persuaded her gnome friend to relocate her to the wilderness around Vasselheim where she could hunt the wildlife there and would be safe from monster hunters because of the influence of the Slayers’ Take. blog.description: Erin. I would defend Clarke Griffin with my life. Probably 59% The 100, 40% Critical Role, and 1% random nonsense. Not spoiler-free. Bellarke and Fjorester trash. I play video games, read a lot of books, and write. (Other fandoms may include, but are not limited to: Star Wars, GOT, Anne with an E, Crazy Ex-Girlfriend, Stranger Things, Veronica Mars, B99, Superstore)

blog.name: baumguy
blog.title: The Baumhaus
blog.description: Wilkommen, bienvenue and welcome to the Baumhaus! Now listen, I'm really just a big nerd. If you're here, you gonna find the various personal, comic, theatrical, and d&d related shenanigans that one would expect from a Baumguy. Shameless plugs incoming. Enjoy your stay.

summary: CritRole x One Piece
body:
CritRole x One Piece

So, in the latest japanese chapter of One Piece, Trafalgar Law and Basil Hawkins begin to go head to head, and it looks like it’ll be a rough fight. As some of you may know, Matthew Mercer voices Law and Taliesin Alxelrod Jaffe plays Hawkins in the English DUB.

So anyways, the Wano DUB is gonna have a lot of great Critical Role moments (even more if we get additional flashbacks of Ace, who was played by Travis Willingham), and I’m excited to hear Matt and Taliesin more in One Piece in general.

summary: Awful CR theory
title: Awful CR theory
body:
Eodwulf is a werewolf, because Ikithon thought it would be both useful and (given his name) amusing.

That’s why Caleb doesn’t like dogs.

summary: Can we talk about how Jester grew up super isolated with absolutely no one in her life besides her mom and the Traveler, and how...
body: Can we talk about how Jester grew up super isolated with absolutely no one in her life besides her mom and the Traveler, and how lonely that must have been, and now she has the ability to literally talk to anyone no matter how far away they are, and I love love love that Laura Bailey has her use Sending at literally every single opportunity.

reblog.comment: Can we talk about how Jester grew up super isolated with absolutely no one in her life besides her mom and the Traveler, and how lonely that must have been, and now she has the ability to literally talk to anyone no matter how far away they are, and I love love love that Laura Bailey has her use Sending at literally every single opportunity.
